books.title: My First Summer in the Sierra
books.author: John Muir
books.summary: The influential Scottish-American naturalist spends a summer exploring the high country surrounding the headwaters of the Merced and Tuolumne rivers in the Sierra Nevada, and records what he sees in a diary.

books.title: Pimpernel and Rosemary
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A famous journalist is drawn into the intrigues of two Eastern European nations in the aftermath of World War I.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: Nils Holgersson, transformed to an elf, learns the meaning of kindness during his adventures with a flock of wild geese.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: The Tragical History of Doctor Faustus
books.author: Christopher Marlowe
books.summary: Dr. Faustus sells his soul to Lucifer in return for magical powers.

books.title: Kai Lung’s Golden Hours
books.author: Ernest Bramah
books.summary: An ancient Chinese storyteller charged with treason uses his beguiling tales to avoid conviction.

books.title: Bertram Cope’s Year
books.author: Henry Blake Fuller
books.summary: A young literature instructor navigates social and romantic complexities in a university town.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: Mystery at Lynden Sands
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: A Chief Constable’s holiday on the coast is interrupted when he is drawn into investigating a murder.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: The Demi-Gods
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Three demi-gods descend among humanity in the form of angels, stumbling upon a father, his daughter, and their donkey traveling around rural Ireland.

books.title: North of Boston
books.author: Robert Frost
books.summary: A collection of Frost’s poetry.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: Armageddon 2419 A.D.
books.author: Philip Francis Nowlan
books.summary: Adventure hero Buck Rogers battles the forces of the evil Han Empire in 2419 America.

books.title: Ukridge Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of stories featuring P. G. Wodehouse’s charismatic character Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge.

books.title: Polynesian Mythology
books.author: George Grey
books.summary: A collection of Māori mythology covering the start of the universe through to the spread of Māori tribes through New Zealand’s North Island.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
